title: Social Media-Based Language Education Professional Development: Enhancing Practitioner Competencies and Collaborative Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the field, foundational grammar and vocabulary instruction experience, proficiency in digital communication tools, and basic competency in text analysis and writing feedback
context.additional_context: A process where practicing professionals engage in social media-based learning communities to experience expertise transformation. Primarily asynchronous learning activities using digital devices, emphasizing sharing practical applications in language education. Focuses on developing specific instructional techniques—text analysis, writing feedback, intercultural communication strategies—and highlights activities using diverse language materials (texts, videos, audio) to enhance learners' expressive and reading skills.

learning_goals: Learners can present at least three scientifically grounded inquiry strategies (e.g., vocabulary expansion, grammar feedback, cultural context integration) applicable to language education practice by analyzing educational utilization strategies of social media platforms

Learners collaborate with peer practitioners in social media-based learning communities to develop and evidence-based evaluate at least two innovative language education cases (e.g., integrated reading-writing activities, multimedia resource utilization)

Learners compile three networking cases, five knowledge-sharing contents, and three global perspective-related materials collected from six months of social media activities (LinkedIn, Twitter, X, etc.) into a portfolio, and are evaluated with 80+ points based on an institutional rubric (expression 40%, comprehension 40%, professional growth 20%)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
